website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon AF-S Nikkor 24-85mm f/3.5-4.5G ED VR is a compact, inexpensive zoom for full-frame shooters, but captures images with noticeable distortion.

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: This came as the kit lens for a Nikon D610 I bought, and it works fine as a kit lens. In the centre of the lens it focuses well and the image is sharp. It's less sharp at the corners, and there is some distortion at the corners of pictures (the centre of the picture bows), when the focal length is under 35mm. This can be dealt with in programmes like Lightroom though. In life, you get what you pay for, and this is a cheep lens for FX cameras. This said it's a good lens for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bowen

customer_reviews.title: its good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so its good for the price,but not as great as some of the reviews i`m reading on here....when at 24mm its not that sharp and at 70mm its blurry, but I cant find anything better at this price range....cant wait till i can afford a £1000 lens really.......
customer_reviews.author: stu arts

customer_reviews.title: The best zoom lens !
customer_reviews.text: Quality and sharpness of this lens is better than any of the primes i've used even at f2.8. Bokeh is of very good quality too . Focus speed is lightning fast even in poor lighting conditions. New vr is out but not sure wether vr will make difference as i've never had issues with blurry images with this lens. A bit heavy though especially with my d750
customer_reviews.author: jeeves

customer_reviews.title: Simply excellent quality standard lens
customer_reviews.text: Having used the latest 24-120mm f4 VR lens for a year or so on a D700, I was finding that when I upgraded to D800, the very slight weaknesses in the 24-120 were becoming evident on occasions (big enlargements). Moving to this lens just showed that although it is an older lens and lacks VR (it would be bigger and heavier with it, I guess) the larger aperture definitely allows better view of what you are photographing, and the quality of the glass is simply excellent. It is not a lens you can use so easily as your only travel lens, but it does give the best quality as long as you can hold your camera steady.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C

customer_reviews.title: Not too heavy,and low profile.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a good while now and I have to say, if I had to take only one lens on holiday with me with My Flash with Cam, it would be this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: A good start.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a full frame (FX) camera body and wanted a reasonably priced zoom lens to suit. I considered other brands but chose this one to match the camera. No problems so far. I've got some saving up to do though before I buy one with fast glass or a longer zoom. FX lenses don't come cheap.
customer_reviews.author: DB.

customer_reviews.title: but absolutely good enough to produce high quality imagery for commercial purposes
customer_reviews.text: Not the latest, but absolutely good enough to produce high quality imagery for commercial purposes, while keeping overheads in check. No qualms shooting this wide-open, when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Barney B.

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is expensive, but its worth every penny. I use it daily and am still amazed with the sharpness and IQ this lens delivers. AF is lightning quick, and virtually always spot on. Bokeh is to die for, built like a tank, simply the best. Only down side is its bulk and weight (with the hood on this is a big lens!), but its the price you pay for fast pro glass.
customer_reviews.author: MFranks

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed.
customer_reviews.text: First I was sceptical buying from the Warehouse Deal , but I have to say that the product was in perfect shape, no usage marks on it, it is just flawless. The fact that I could buy it with a discount of 400 eur is great!!!!! The lens itself is amazing, I don't have words to describe it. I am using it on a Nikon D7000 previously used with N 17-55 2.8 . It becomes a 36-105 on my DX so with this 2 lens I have all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cracking lens for the money, well built and the VR is fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. S. Haigh

customer_reviews.title: Another Nikon winner
customer_reviews.text: This is another excellent lens from Nikon with all of the typical high quality optics that you would expect. I find this very useful for everyday use as it offers good landscape with reasonable zoom but not too heavy around my neck.
customer_reviews.author: Michael smith

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens, it exceeded my expectations and has become my go-to lens for out-and-about general photography.
customer_reviews.author: ralphy

customer_reviews.title: Professional all-round lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a 2.8 professional lens from NIkkor (Nikon). It's buildt to outlast you , and almost smells of quality. I have this on my camera 99% of the time, it does a wonderful job. Quick to focus, very good in low light. Only negative aspect is that it is quite heavy and big - my former lens was a 17-55 2.8 DX (this covers the same range due to the size of the sensor) and it was significantly smaller. If you are an occational photographer it might not be for you, the sixe and price considered. But if you are a serious photographer this is the first lens you shoud get.
customer_reviews.author: Stig Bordsenius

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S Nikkor 24-70mm f2.8
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! Can zoom lenses really be this good? This Nikon beast sure proves that they can. I could and still cannot fault this marvellous creation. I've produced some excellent work under many conditions and this lens took everything in its stride. But then it is a NIKON! Bargain!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Prof.

customer_reviews.title: Just buy one.
customer_reviews.text: Great lens, sharp and little chromatic aberration that is easy to remove in post processing.
customer_reviews.author: StevenB

customer_reviews.title: Superb Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is the best 35mm lens I've ever owned. It is fairly weighty so carrying around all day can be a chore but it more than rewards your efforts by giving superb results. There is a really sweet spot around f9-11 but even wide open this delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lens, good quality build for the price, and very sharp
customer_reviews.author: Brian E. Viercant

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hoping to test soon but goods arrived as said very happy
customer_reviews.author: Lesley H.

customer_reviews.title: What a lense!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It's fast, accurate and sharp. Cons: It's heavy and costly. Would I recommend it? Without hesitation. In my case, the cost was forgotten as soon as I saw the quality of my pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Iggy

customer_reviews.title: a good lens, works fine
customer_reviews.text: AS you would expect, a good lens, works fine. Good price so very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Glendinning

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who appeared to be over the moon - so I suppose it's a success!!
customer_reviews.author: FJ

customer_reviews.title: The VR feature
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens for portrait and landscape. Auto focus features also excellent
customer_reviews.author: A.W.STONE

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 24 -70mm f2.8 lens
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality professional lens.Photos are very sharp and good natural colour contrast.Excellent for night photography.VR would have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford

customer_reviews.title: superb
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely superb lens! Yes, rather expensive but what a lens for my D800! Crisp, clear, sharp and above all stable lens!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Prante

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent delivery service, came 1 day earlier than expected. Good quality lens too, really happy!
customer_reviews.author: kieran kit

customer_reviews.title: Great general purpose top line lens
customer_reviews.text: Superb. Covers the needs of 80% of my photography, and going out to 85MM so much beter than standard 55 mm lens. Apperature also great
customer_reviews.author: John Wheadon

customer_reviews.title: Good quality lens.
customer_reviews.text: An extremely versatile lens which is usable under all circumstances. I am using it with a D3S body and getting extremely good results from it. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K. S. Sethna

customer_reviews.title: Extremely good quality and sharpness
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are very sharp and vivid. It is possible to crop without losing any visible quality. Of course a heavy piece, but you need to be strong to reach the top :-)
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar Meller

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens
customer_reviews.text: Your perception of photography will change after using this lens. Fantastic lens, crisp image quality, really good for low light photography.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens as a walkabout lens for holiday as I did not want to be changing lens very often. I was not disappointed. The lens is not too heavy, the focus is fast and accurate and the images are sharp. There is some distortion at the wide end, but lens correction software takes care of this. There is no lens creep on this 24-85 and the VR is almost silent. I was suprised by how close you can focus on subjects too. All in all a lovely lens and if you dont want to be changing too many times I would recommend the 24-85mm VR. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Dougie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from lesser quality Nikon lenses it is pretty amazing even at end print size you see the difference. The lens does suffer from some distortion at the 24 mm end, but using lens profiles in Adobe Lightroom this is easy to fix. It's not that noticeable on subjects - just backgrounds. BUT then any 24MM suffers from this it's not an issue. An amazing lens and a joy to own and use.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Practical zoom range
customer_reviews.text: This chunky little zoom covers landscape to portraiture ranges and therefore isn't the bank breaker of other zooms by Nikon. It's an 'if in doubt' lens, because if you're not sure what you'll need it'll do the job for any outing, particularly if there's enough light. For this reason it's not quite a dusk to dawn lens, but everything in between. The front of the barrel doesn't rotate which is good when using a polarising filter, even though such filters lose another couple of stops of light. For my camera bag a fast standard 50mm, a super wide angle zoom, this lens and a zoom going out to 300mm is lens heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Pooter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect walk around lens
customer_reviews.text: This is the best universal lens I have ever used with my Nikon D700. perfect for pretty much everything. Portraits, landscape, night pictures, animals, children. The quality of the optics is awesome (better on the wider end). Autofocus is instant but silent.
customer_reviews.author: hateom

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, fabulous optics and a complete pleasure to use. Weight and size are perfect. The quality of photos captured must be seen to believe. Glad I bought this and not the cheaper sigma (I like sigma but if you can choke up the money, then this is the best). This has been my standard soon lens since I bought it and just love it. I use it with my full frame Nikon D600 and the output is awesome. steady, excellent optics, great and easy to use. Ever wondered why this has been long standing non replaced number 1 in this type of lenses and range? Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Abhishek Sringeri

customer_reviews.title: Stunning Lens
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens to go with my new D800 - what a combination! The lens is as sharp as anything under the many varied conditions I have used it under. The combination is a bit on teh heavy side, so be prepared for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful Lens
customer_reviews.text: Had tried the Tamron 24-70 VC, but it suffered terrible back focus issue even although it looked sharp on the viewfinder. This lens is just a beast, since modern FX camera these days can bump the ISO up to 3200 without any noticeable noise, the lack of VR even at 70mm would certainly do the job absolutely well even at low lit situation :) Sharpness is as good as the primes, no fringing from the photos even when wide open.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Great little lens for travelling
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens, it's light and sharp. This was permanently on my D800 for my two week holiday in Norway recently. Yes I was thinking of going for the 24-70 f2.8, which everyone rates as the No. 1 lens, but reviews of it's weight and cost put me off. So I decided to go for this little baby and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Bluetoon

customer_reviews.title: Quality lens, quality images
customer_reviews.text: Lots of people talk about the weight as a negative, but I find it a reassuring positive. A sign of a good build and durable enough to take the many bangs in life this lens will no doubt take. Pin sharp throughout the image, when combined with the 70-200 it gives you enough coverage to tackle most assignments. Would thoroughly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: DanLaw

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed in sharpness, especially at wide angles.
customer_reviews.text: I've read a lot about this lens, and of course it's one of Nikon's "Holy Trinity" of zooms, but I was disappointed in the sharpness, particularly at the wider end. I got this lens to replace my 28mm and 50mm, but to be honest, I miss my 50mm too much. This lens excels at versatility that you don't get with a prime, but I was hoping for more performance for such a huge chunk of cash.
customer_reviews.author: Boz

customer_reviews.title: ... lens that has not been said VR would be good with it
customer_reviews.text: What can i say about this lens that has not been said VR would be good with it ,i use it with a D800 (now out of date) as with all nikon top lenses they are pricey
customer_reviews.author: donald mackay

customer_reviews.title: So it was returned to Amazon as it may have been a bad example of the lens
customer_reviews.text: The focus points were very soft, and not razor sharp as i expected. So it was returned to Amazon as it may have been a bad example of the lens.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Groves

customer_reviews.title: great product in perfect condition with super fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: I'd been thinking of buying this lens for a very long time because of the expensive price and the heavy weight. However, I can't be happier when I receive it. The lens came in perfect condition, shinny brand new. The delivery time from Amazon is as quick as always. The price from Amazon is around 200 euro cheaper than my local camera shop. I'm also very happy with the results of the lens. Super fast focus, silent motor, sharp clarity...etc. can't find any faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Jialin

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and fast focus
customer_reviews.text: i bought this lens to replace nikon 24-70 f2.8 [nikon 24-70 f2.8 is too heavy for me to carry,in all day weddings], this lens is light weight and fast focus and vr really help.i use this lens on my d3s and loves this combination for every day use.thanks
customer_reviews.author: normanjee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Superb lens, but more suited to FX rather than DX bodies.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is brilliant, I would highly recommend it for daily use, especially it's very light. The picture is amazing :)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. Wojtyczka

customer_reviews.title: Lens does every thing it should packing was fine delivery two days no more could be expected
customer_reviews.text: A light good quality lens ideal for travelling small and discrete with a very useful zoom range would recommend every Nikon full frame user to have one.
customer_reviews.author: Photo 47

customer_reviews.title: My favorate lens, but let down by quality after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: The images from the lens are great, I have been using the lens 90% of the time. However recently I have been hearing a grinding lens between 70 -> 50mm, 50 -> 24mm is as smooth as it has always been. This is very disappointing for a "professional quality" lens and I would expect it to last for years not months. Amazon have been great in sorting out the problem which is a relief. UPDATE =========================== My replacement lens turned up today, it is smooth and as it originally was; I just hope it lasts over 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Lens
customer_reviews.text: I looked around for a good lightweight travel lens for my Nikon D700 and after a lot of test shots this is a great little lens and really sharpe when used around f8-f11.It arrrived from the seller a day early and was in a well packaged box.The only problem is that there was no reciet or order request and as i am a freelance self employed i do need the paper work for tax returns..a real pain!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rose

customer_reviews.title: Work horse but not superstar
customer_reviews.text: Pin sharp as you'd expect from a pro grade lens but the front element moves in and out and so is more susceptible to damage as you might expect from cheaper third party lenses and it suffers from distortion at the edges. Not Nikon's best effort.
customer_reviews.author: Tomsky57

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions, a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love it so far. May change my mind once used in earnest.
customer_reviews.author: Rafe

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality well-made nice leather case
customer_reviews.text: Tried this lens vs the Tameron 24 to 70, I couldn't get on with this lens primarily due to no VR. Very good quality well-made nice leather case
customer_reviews.author: MR T O'SULLIVAN

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it - as it was not made ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it - as it was not made plain that it was a "Grey Import" i.e. not guaranteed by the manufacturer/importer
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: OK kit lens
customer_reviews.text: this lens is an OK kit lens .. sharp central and less sharp peripheral and corners .. nice build and small size .. accurate focusing but not instant ..
customer_reviews.author: HewMe

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lens, totally sharp. However was no use for professional work due to variable aperture and inconsistent VR
customer_reviews.author: John Miles

customer_reviews.title: Highly versatile
customer_reviews.text: WOW this is the most versatile lens in my bag. I have a f/2.8 version that is a wonderful lens but it is bigger and heavier. This lens is much lighter and a lot more fun to use. It is one of those lenses that hardly ever comes off the camera body to be replaced by a macro, wide, or telephoto. I highly recommend it as a starter lens and wish I'd had it when I started.
customer_reviews.author: M&J

customer_reviews.title: Great General Purpose Lens
customer_reviews.text: All-around I think this is a excellent general purpose lens. It's optically pretty sharp, functions very well mechanically, not heavy, and easy to use. I've gotten some night sky Milky Way shots with it, wide open, that I'm very happy with. The stars at the corners of the frame on my FX camera look as good as the stars near the center of the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: An extremely sharp & lightweight travel lens!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a zoom lens to take on an upcoming trip to Washington, DC that would be great in a multitude of settings without compromising the photo quality and this lens far exceeded my expectations. It's not a replacement for a prime lens on portrait or wide angle photography, but it is a perfect travel companion when you only want to take one lens along instead of an arsenal of primes. It is lightweight for a zoom lens and fits perfectly in my small camera bag. A great travel lens for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: The Rosy Cup

customer_reviews.title: Great travel lens
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly sharp, lighter than the pro level, and fast. A nice travel lens when you don’t need 2.8. Several favorable reviews (Thom, Nasim, Ken) prompted me to give this lens a try, and with Amazons’ terrific return policy I had nothing to lose. Using it with a Nikon DF, and D500 where it has a 36-120ish range.
customer_reviews.author: j steven sanders

customer_reviews.title: Lens as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Came with front and rear caps and original lens hood. The glass looks perfect, just a little dust under the front elements which is common for zooms, the dust won't affect photos. Autofocus and VR appears to work perfectly. Only issue is that Amazon could have used a smaller box so that the item wouldn't move around inside as mush during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kruse

customer_reviews.title: Great for a walk-around lens.
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 5 stars for what it is...it's a great walk around lens. There is a lot of distortion at the low and high ends when the lens is wide open. More than I am used to seeing. I bought this because I wanted something I could use as a walk around, and having some experience with hauling the monster (f2.8 24-70), I decided to lighten things up. No contest between those two lenses in terms of quality of build or results...but huge differences in terms of price and weight. For what I bought it for...it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good Low Cost Lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for my arsenal. Takes great sharp shots and didn't cost me an arm and a leg. Needed a macro lens real quick and was pleasantly surprised at the quality. Check on line for reviews that back up my statement, you'll find it is highly recommended. If you don't absolutely require a 2.8 this will fit the bill nicely without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good general purpose lens with room for camera growth.
customer_reviews.text: I don't own Nikon full frame cameras but bought this lens because it's a good range of focal lengths for my use. I am mostly interested in portraits and street shooting. It's sharp everywhere and plays well on a cropped from camera like a D7100. I also like that it covers a full frame should I add one in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Incredable focus when matched with the Nikon D850
customer_reviews.text: I have great respect for this lens. I took a photo of a map from eight feet distance and the sharpness is better than your eyes at inches distance. Price is reasonable quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jack McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to test this lens today and am pleasantly surprised. This lens is sharp and has decent depth. Color contrast and micro contrast also good. This lens is sharp wide open and fully zoomed. I definitely recommend this lens as an all around and portrait lens.
customer_reviews.author: ErwinKennedy

customer_reviews.title: Very good one!
customer_reviews.text: A very good lens, and works perfectly with my Nikon D750!
customer_reviews.author: Hosam

customer_reviews.title: Slow delivery
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is as described. The estimated delivery date was off and I lost a customer. In the future it would be nice if they could deliver on this written promise
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 24-85 Lens
customer_reviews.text: I have several Nikons - D-300 and D-700 - and wanted a better travel lens for the 700. This one is probably not as "strong" as the 2.8 version, but it is lighter and with the D-700, I can goose up the ISO (speed) to compensate for one less stop. I consider myself a pro and make part of my living taking photos for my books. This should be a good companion for travel, when I don't want an extra 5 pounds of lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Great all-purpose lens
customer_reviews.text: While some may argue that a mid-range zoom is unnecessary or "un-pro-like," I've found this lens to be a great all-purpose walkabout lens. If I am after a specific look when out doing street photography, then I grab one of my prime lenses because I am afforded more stops (1.8 on my 50 and 85mm compared to 3.5 on this zoom). Otherwise, this lens is on my D700. It is sharp, fast, accurate and quiet (VR). I was and still am very pleased with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Distant Planet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the excellent quality of this lens and the VR is exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Excellent general purpose lens and a perfect companion for the Nikon D600. Fast handling and lovely images. Vibration Reduction is essential for sharp pix with 24MP D600 or 36MP D800 but Nikon offers only a few VR full frame lenses. I have the VR 105 Macro and the VR 16-35 wide zoom but they are both so big and heavy. So this one is a must-have. Zoom lenses are said not to be as sharp as prime lenses but who cares - so much more convenient for fast shooting. Reasonably priced. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor.Generosity

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this to complement my few lens for my Nikon D850. Very pleased with it all around.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with the result so far very light lens
customer_reviews.text: I used it with my Nikon D610 both in daylight and at night doing nightscapes. The Photo included is of the western horizon Belen,NM. 20 second exposure, iso 1600, f/4, lens at 24mm. I am pleased with the result so far very light lens.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN L.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp as a tack with good autofocus performance
customer_reviews.text: This lens is very sharp. We have been getting good performance with autofocus, as well. This lens has become our everyday lens on a Nikon D810 and D5500.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: 24-85mm f/3.5-4.5G ED
customer_reviews.text: As is usual with Nikon products, this lens serves impeccably. It's fast focusing and although is not up to the standards of the 24-70mm lens, does a very respectable job. It's also lighter than the 24-70.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: sharp lens
customer_reviews.text: I still hsve use this lens mre to see howvit performs under various scenes. Si far so good.
customer_reviews.author: rafatruji

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD LENS IDEAL FOR LANDSCAPE
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my D750 and I keep it on my camera all the time. It's sharp, and the colors I get are vibrant and natural. In my opinion it is particularly efficient in landscape but also portrait can be handled without problems. People who are looking for a zoom lens of this focal excursion should have no problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Houston Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This Nikon AF-S Nikkor 24-85 gets good results with my Nikon 610 camera.
customer_reviews.author: Carole S. Graff

customer_reviews.title: New Nikon Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Though there is some distortion that can be handled by Photoshop the latest Nikon firmware update contains the corrective lens profile needed. Having said that the lens handles beautifully and makes for a nice normal carry around, walk about street lens.
customer_reviews.author: Edward G. Dickau

customer_reviews.title: great functional lens
customer_reviews.text: great lens. It's my first experience w/ full-frame & FX and it was definitely worth the upgrade. The lens feels solid & w/ a zoom of 24-85 fits 99% of daily needs, thought the lowest f/stop is 3.5. If I need a little more bokeh, the software I have is great (Alien Skin).
customer_reviews.author: MJO

customer_reviews.title: Great walk around zoom for D810, and it doesn't break the bank.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a walk around zoom for the D810, I was worried I wasn't going to find a sharp lens to complement the 36mp sensor, without spending an arm and a leg. I'm very impressed by this lens, it's ability to resolve, color, size and weight. And it is pretty wide as well. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Powderhound2

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: I like this lens as I can do some versatile shooting while walking around. But to carry just one lens for a day, I wish it I could reach out a little further than the 85mm will allow. For the price the speed is fine. Quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: bigpops

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens, but you lose a stop or so
customer_reviews.text: Great, lightweight lens. Perfect as a walkaround because of its weight and size. I only have a couple complaints: - Bokeh makes distracting shapes when the background is high-contrast in value or color. It's not very noticeable in most cases but on rare occasion rears its ugly head. - Is strangely darker than my other lenses. I think I'm losing a stop or two of light with everything on the same settings. Luckily, the vibration reduction is great and makes up for the lost light. I'd still recommend the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel D. Nielson

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for your FX body.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens. This past month I moved up from using a DX camera kit to a FX camera. The lens is superb and has great clarity. Came with lens hood.
customer_reviews.author: L. Roth

customer_reviews.title: I am satisfied with the function and view of the lens
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with the function and view of the lens. I appreciate it very much. The focus is clear. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: shidaz

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a high quality general carry around for family photo's on my D800. These are not cheap lenses as some would like to say because they do not weigh 3 pounds and cost $2000+. Nikon often puts wonderful optics in their lower build lenses a lot of high quality plastic rather than metal. I have been using this lens since its first day of issue and I remain very pleased - it gives one very sharp, good contrast and color plus VR. It is a pleasure. I love my 2-3 lb Prof. Lenses and I also appreciate the lightweights!
customer_reviews.author: Zeb

customer_reviews.title: Nice economic lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful lens, sharp focus and the zoom is quite versatile. I just have a little confusion about what happens if I forget to turn off the VR when swapping out the lens. The manual says I may hear a rattling sound but I don't .
customer_reviews.author: J. GochenouerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Photos
customer_reviews.text: Very good lens, excellent photos, lightweight, fast focus, replaced a larger heavier more expensive lens with no loss on performance.
customer_reviews.author: Luis G. De La Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Having a battery of prime Nikkors from the seventies, I resisted this lens for a number of months after I got my D-600, but I finally relented and it is convenient as a carry always lens. The images it produces seem excellent. It is heavy, but manageable.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Yowell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens
customer_reviews.text: One of my modt used lenses. Every photographer must have one!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Fabsits

customer_reviews.title: A great walking around lens.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great, light walk around lens for every day use. My only complaint would be the tulip lens shade. My style of shooting requires something a little less obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stocks

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a great lens for the price and the vibration reduction is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S Smith

customer_reviews.title: Check for lens hood fitment on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Lense appears to be in good condition with everything in working order. Lens hood is either the wrong size or is broken and does not stay on the lense in either orientation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved this lens and got several years use
customer_reviews.text: I loved this lens and got several years use, but lens failed on me! I did not contact seller.....about issues due to the time I had it!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Mabry Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love! What a great every day lens! A friend recommended it to me and I'm thrilled. I'm testing it now and will add to this review over time, but fisrt blush is it is fabulous, a perfect companion to my D800.
customer_reviews.author: ACRA

customer_reviews.title: Great Walkabout/Multi-Purpose Lens
customer_reviews.text: So far, I really like this lens. It's clear, great for multiple purposes (portraits, scenery, etc.). I like it for the "walkabout" factor. When you're not sure what you're going to be shooting and/or you don't want to switch lenses often, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Nat Rose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: lens is much sharper than I expected....this lens has become my all around lens
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: Handy all-around compact zoom
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens. Smaller and lighter than the 24-120mm and has sufficient range for most walk around needs. Works well on the D750.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp
customer_reviews.text: Super all around lens with VR for Nikon mount . This is a great lens that can be carried all day without the sore shoulders the next day and it gets the job done. Quality lens without the big price
customer_reviews.author: Ronny

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: so far so good love the lens will be buying another lens soon
customer_reviews.author: vincent weaver

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. Great for the price. Works well with my d7200.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

product_meta.title: NIKON 24-85mm F/3.5-4.5G ED VR AF-S Nikkor Lens - White Box
product_meta.description:
Optical formula optimized for use with Nikon FX-format digital SLRs, provides sharp and high contrast images and HD video from infinity to close up. 36 -127.5mm focal length equivalent when mounted on DX-format D-SLR.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


Advanced and versatile FX-format standard zoom with VR II image stabilization. 
Covering a versatile wide angle to medium telephoto zoom range, the new AF-S NIKKOR 24–85mm f/3.5-4.5G ED VR delivers noticeably sharper photos and HD videos thanks to Nikon's second-generation Vibration Reduction technology (VR II). Shoot at shutter speeds up to 4-times slower than would otherwise be possible for greater low-light capability, and enjoy the benefits of Vibration Reduction during HD video recording—even when using a tripod. 


SAMPLE PHOTOGRAPHY
A range of possibilities View larger Razor-sharp, high contrast results View larger Unwavering performance View larger 
FEATURES:
Vibration Reduction 
A Nikon in-lens technology that improves image stability by automatically compensating for camera shake. Lenses that offer VR will feature the abbreviation VR on the lens barrel.

Nikon Silent Wave Motor
A significant innovation in AF lens technology, Nikon's Silent Wave Motor uses ultrasonic (inaudible) vibrations—rather than a gear system—to focus the lens, providing incredibly smooth, silent and precise autofocus operation.

M/A Focus Mode Switch
When fine manual focusing is needed, simply rotate the lens focus ring—M/A mode allows you to seamlessly override the AF system with virtually no time lag.

AS
AS stands for Aspherical lens elements. This type of lens utilizes non-spherical surfaces on either one or both sides of the glass in order to eliminate certain types of lens aberration. 

Super Integrated Coating
Nikon's Super Integrated Coating enhances light transmission efficiency and offers superior color consistency and reduced lens flare.

ED (Extra-Low Dispersion Glass)
An optical glass developed by Nikon that is used with normal optical glass in telephoto lenses to obtain optimum correction of chromatic aberrations.

IF Lens
A NIKKOR lens in which only the internal lens group shifts during focusing. These lenses will be designated with the abbreviation IF on the lens barrel.


How to read the MTF curve chart Lens Construction

1 Extra low Dispersion (ED) Element. Maximum aperture : f/3.5-4.5. Minimum aperture : f/22-29
No. of diaphragm blades 7 (rounded diaphragm opening)
